metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1530 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The docshell implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 29.0, Firefox ESR 24.x before 24.5, Thunderbird before 24.5, and SeaMonkey before 2.26 allows remote attackers to trigger the loading of a URL with a spoofed baseURI property, and conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, via a crafted web site that performs history navigation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1530` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:24.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
